Abandoned
Some minor observations
If the ordering of the items are not important (which is the case here likely) then we can use unordered_map for more faster access
Done
I guess we can have one try and two catch blocks combined here.
Done
use "return createDumpEntry(dumpParams);" directly
Done
I still don't see the changes
Done
The function returns some object path as well which good to have been mentioned
Done
One suggestion is yet to be implemented

As found from the header files in SDK
```
struct Disabled final :public sdbusplus::exception::generated_exception
struct generated_exception : public exception

class SdBusError final : public internal_exception
```

this is the hierarchy I see so any Disabled/QuotaExceeded exception will not come in this path it will go into std::exception path
I see it is implemented like this in other repos too, from DBus we are getting a dbus exception and inside the actual exception is coming as a message, I have tested it and found
Do not see any exception called DumpDisabled

it is defined as part of the dump create interface
sdbusplus::xyz::openbmc_project::Dump::Create::Error::Disabled
Then it is going as a dbus exception not the specific exception
assuming stoi fails and ends up here, we rethrow that exception and caller will crash as this is not a D-Bus exception is this expected? probably ok as it rarely happens.
if a throw is here, the caller will not crash but this application will crash as it is not handled in higher levels, I dont think we have anything else to do in that case
